meanings.definition: The quality or state of being like a priest.
meanings.sent1: Her priestliness shone through as she comforted the grieving family.
meanings.sent2: The priest's priestliness was evident in his compassionate actions.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at priestliness by wearing a robe to work made his colleagues chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The calm and serene aura of the garden had a priestliness about it.
meanings.sent5: The old library exuded a sense of priestliness with its hushed atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The behavior or characteristics associated with a priest.
meanings.sent1: The priest's priestliness was reflected in his kind gestures towards everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her priestliness was evident in the way she listened attentively to others.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at priestliness by blessing his coffee before drinking it raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The priestliness of the community was evident in their willingness to help those in need.
meanings.sent5: The priestliness of the old man was seen in his wise and gentle demeanor.

meanings.definition: The manner or demeanor of a priest.
meanings.sent1: His priestliness was apparent in the way he spoke with a calming tone.
meanings.sent2: The priest's priestliness was evident in his patient and understanding nature.
meanings.sent3: Her attempt at priestliness by wearing a stole as a fashion statement raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The priestliness of the old church was felt in the quiet reverence of its halls.
meanings.sent5: The priestliness of the young boy was seen in his respectful and humble attitude.
